an10.111:1.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
an10.111:2.1: “Sir, they speak of the one called ‘an adept’.
an10.111:2.2: How is an adept mendicant defined?”
an10.111:2.3: “Mendicant, it’s when a mendicant has an adept’s right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.
an10.111:2.4: That’s how a mendicant is an adept.”
